definition[0]: to increase something by a small amount, especially after a series of increases, or to increase in this way
example[0]: The debate will ratchet up a notch on Wednesday when the Commission publishes its report.
example[1]: Raising the minimum wage would ratchet up real incomes in general.
definition[1]: to increase, or make something increase
example[2]: Environmental standards were ratcheted up to meet demands for clean water.
example[3]: Raising the base rate will ratchet up the cost of borrowing.
